ground_truth: He turns to go, and Snape turns back and raises his eyebrows. With determination, Umbridge raises her wand in the Forbidden Forest. Harry catches up with Hermione as the frayed end of Gwarp's rope lies on the ground. Umbridge is dirty and disheveled when shadowy creatures appear amongst the trees. Umbridge steps back nervously and wags a finger. They have bows and arrows, and she deflects an arrow. She points her wand, and a centaur falls, a strangling rope around its throat, as it writhes and thrashes. Hermione tries to release it, but Umbridge is lifted into the air by Gwarp. The centaurs charge, firing arrows, and pierced by arrows, Gwarp drops Umbridge. The centaurs grab her, and she is carried off. They run back through the forest towards Hogwarts, where Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron run to meet them. Harry faces his friends, and they, along with Hermione, Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, soar above the pine forest astride the leathery back of a thestral. Harry holds on tightly and looks around at his companions, and flying close behind, Luna gives him a happy smile. The thestrals fly through the stormy night buffeted by strong winds, and at last, the familiar lights of Canary Wharf and the winding River Thames appear below them. They run through the deserted Ministry of Magic towards a long corridor lined with shiny black tiles. Harry moves forward cautiously, and the others follow him along the black corridor towards the blue door at the far end. Inside is a shadowy storeroom full of high, wooden shelves, and they hold up their lighted wands. Standing on the numbered shelves are thousands of cloudy glass spheres as the door behind them slides away. The rows of glass spheres fill the shelves, which stand close together and extend upwards high above their heads. By the light of his wand, Harry searches the long, dark passages between the shelves and stops to shine his wand down onto the empty floor. He turns to his friends, as Neville is reading a label on a shelf beneath one of the spheres. As Harry walks towards it, the sphere starts to glow, illuminating the swirling mist inside it, and Harry reaches out and lifts it down. Harry steps in front of his friends, and they move closer together as a masked Death Eater approaches slowly along the passage. Lucius Malfoy unmasks, and Harry holds Neville back as dark figures approach down the passageways. The masked figures draw closer, and the friends run for it, but Lucius appears in front of them, so they turn back. Luna is knocked down, but she raises her wand, and her attacker vanishes. Neville stuns a Death Eater, and Luna pulls him away as more Death Eaters appear to block the passages. Pursued, Hermione flicks her wand, and glass spheres smash down onto their pursuers.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He rotates to depart, and Snape rotates back and elevates his eyebrows. With resolve, Umbridge elevates her wand in the Forbidden Forest. Harry overtakes Hermione as the worn end of Gwarp's cord rests on the ground. Umbridge is filthy and unkempt when shadowy creatures emerge amongst the trees. Umbridge steps back anxiously and wags a finger. They have bows and arrows, and she deflects an arrow. She gestures her wand, and a centaur falls, a choking cord around its throat, as it writhes and thrashes. Hermione endeavors to release it, but Umbridge is elevated into the air by Gwarp. The centaurs charge, launching arrows, and pierced by arrows, Gwarp releases Umbridge. The centaurs seize her, and she is carried off. They sprint back through the forest towards Hogwarts, where Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron rush to meet them. Harry confronts his companions, and they, along with Hermione, Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, ascend above the pine forest astride the leathery back of a thestral. Harry grips on firmly and glances around at his comrades, and flying close behind, Luna gives him a cheerful smile. The thestrals soar through the turbulent night buffeted by powerful winds, and finally, the familiar lights of Canary Wharf and the twisting River Thames emerge below them. They race through the vacant Ministry of Magic towards a long corridor lined with glossy black tiles. Harry advances cautiously, and the others follow him along the black corridor towards the blue door at the far end. Inside is a shadowy storeroom full of high, wooden racks, and they hold up their illuminated wands. Positioned on the numbered racks are thousands of cloudy glass orbs as the door behind them slides away. The rows of glass orbs fill the racks, which stand close together and extend upwards high above their heads. By the light of his wand, Harry examines the long, dark passages between the racks and halts to shine his wand down onto the vacant floor. He rotates to his companions, as Neville is reading a label on a rack beneath one of the orbs. As Harry strides towards it, the orb commences to glow, illuminating the swirling mist within it, and Harry extends out and lifts it down. Harry steps in front of his comrades, and they move closer together as a masked Death Eater approaches slowly along the passage. Lucius Malfoy unmasks, and Harry restrains Neville as dark figures approach down the passageways. The masked figures draw nearer, and the companions dash for it, but Lucius appears in front of them, so they turn back. Luna is knocked down, but she elevates her wand, and her attacker vanishes. Neville stuns a Death Eater, and Luna pulls him away as more Death Eaters appear to obstruct the passages. Pursued, Hermione flicks her wand, and glass orbs shatter down onto their pursuers.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: He is turned to go, and Snape is turned back while his eyebrows are raised. With determination, the wand is raised by Umbridge in the Forbidden Forest. Harry catches up with Hermione as the frayed end of Gwarp's rope is lying on the ground. Umbridge is dirty and disheveled when shadowy creatures appear amongst the trees. A step back is taken nervously by Umbridge, and a finger is wagged. Bows and arrows are had by them, and an arrow is deflected by her. Her wand is pointed, and a centaur is made to fall, a strangling rope placed around its throat, as it writhes and thrashes. It is tried to be released by Hermione, but Gwarp lifts Umbridge into the air. The centaurs charge, firing arrows, and pierced by arrows, Umbridge is dropped by Gwarp. Her captors grab her, and she carries them off. Back through the forest towards Hogwarts, they run, where Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron meet them. Harry faces his friends, and they, along with Hermione, Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, are soared above the pine forest astride the leathery back of a thestral. Harry tightly holds on and looks around at his companions, and a happy smile is given to him by Luna flying close behind. Through the stormy night, thestrals fly buffeted by strong winds, and at last, the familiar lights of Canary Wharf and the winding River Thames are seen below them. Through the deserted Ministry of Magic, they run towards a long corridor lined with shiny black tiles. Harry moves forward cautiously, and he is followed by the others along the black corridor towards the blue door at the far end. Inside is a shadowy storeroom full of high, wooden shelves, and their lighted wands are held up. On the numbered shelves, thousands of cloudy glass spheres stand as the door slides away behind them. The rows of glass spheres fill the shelves, standing close together and extending upwards high above their heads. By the light of his wand, the long, dark passages between the shelves are searched by Harry, who stops to shine his wand down onto the empty floor. He is turned to his friends as a label is being read by Neville on a shelf beneath one of the spheres. As Harry walks towards it, the sphere is started to glow, illuminating the swirling mist inside it, and it is reached out for and lifted down by Harry. Harry steps in front of his friends, and they are moved closer together as a masked Death Eater slowly approaches along the passage. Lucius Malfoy unmasks, and Neville is held back by Harry as dark figures approach down the passageways. The masked figures draw closer, and it is run for by the friends, but Lucius appears in front of them, so back they turn. Luna is knocked down, but her wand is raised, and her attacker vanishes. A Death Eater is stunned by Neville, and he is pulled away by Luna as more Death Eaters appear to block the passages. Pursued, her wand is flicked by Hermione, and glass spheres are smashed down onto their pursuers.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He turns to leave, and Snape raises his eyebrows. Determined, Umbridge raises her wand in the Forbidden Forest. Harry catches up with Hermione as Gwarp's rope lies frayed on the ground. Umbridge, dirty and disheveled, steps back nervously when shadowy creatures appear. She deflects an arrow and points her wand, causing a centaur to fall with a rope around its throat. Hermione tries to help, but Gwarp lifts Umbridge. The centaurs charge, firing arrows, and Gwarp, pierced by arrows, drops Umbridge. The centaurs seize her and carry her off. They run back to Hogwarts, where Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron meet them. Harry and his friends, including Hermione, Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, soar above the pine forest on a thestral. Harry holds on tightly, looking at his companions, and Luna smiles at him. The thestrals fly through the stormy night, and eventually, Canary Wharf and the River Thames appear below. They run through the deserted Ministry of Magic towards a corridor lined with shiny black tiles. Harry cautiously leads them along the corridor to a blue door. Inside is a shadowy storeroom with high wooden shelves, and they hold up their lighted wands. Thousands of cloudy glass spheres stand on the shelves, which extend high above. By wand light, Harry searches the dark passages and stops to shine his wand on the floor. He turns to his friends as Neville reads a label beneath a sphere. As Harry approaches, the sphere glows, and he lifts it down. Harry steps in front of his friends as a masked Death Eater approaches. Lucius Malfoy unmasks, and Harry holds Neville back as dark figures approach. The friends run, but Lucius blocks them, so they turn back. Luna is knocked down but raises her wand, making her attacker vanish. Neville stuns a Death Eater, and Luna pulls him away as more Death Eaters block the passages. Pursued, Hermione flicks her wand, smashing glass spheres onto their pursuers.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Snape turns back, raising his eyebrows. Determined, Umbridge raises her wand in the Forbidden Forest. Harry catches Hermione as Gwarp's rope lies frayed on the ground. Umbridge, dirty and disheveled, steps back nervously as shadowy creatures appear. She deflects an arrow, points her wand, and a centaur falls, strangled by a rope. Hermione tries to help, but Gwarp lifts Umbridge. Centaurs charge, firing arrows, and Gwarp drops Umbridge, who is carried off. They run to Hogwarts, where Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron meet them. Harry and friends soar on a thestral, Luna smiling. They fly through stormy winds, seeing Canary Wharf and the Thames below. They run through the deserted Ministry of Magic to a corridor with black tiles. Harry leads them to a shadowy storeroom with wooden shelves. They hold lighted wands, seeing thousands of glass spheres. Harry searches the passages, stopping as Neville reads a label. Harry lifts a glowing sphere, and a masked Death Eater approaches. Lucius Malfoy unmasks, and Harry holds Neville back as dark figures approach. The friends run, but Lucius blocks them. Luna is knocked down but vanishes her attacker. Neville stuns a Death Eater, and Luna pulls him away as more appear. Hermione smashes glass spheres onto their pursuers.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He turns to leave, and Snape, with a subtle shift, turns back around and raises his eyebrows in a questioning manner. With unwavering determination, Umbridge confidently raises her wand in the mysterious and foreboding Forbidden Forest. Harry quickly catches up with Hermione just as the frayed end of Gwarp's rope lies discarded on the forest floor. Umbridge appears dirty and disheveled when shadowy, ominous creatures begin to emerge from among the trees. Nervously, Umbridge steps back and wags a finger in a futile attempt to assert control. The creatures are armed with bows and arrows, and she manages to deflect an arrow aimed at her. She points her wand with intent, and a centaur falls to the ground, a strangling rope tightening around its throat as it writhes and thrashes in distress. Hermione desperately tries to release the centaur, but in a sudden turn of events, Umbridge is lifted into the air by Gwarp. The centaurs charge forward, firing arrows with precision, and as Gwarp is pierced by arrows, he drops Umbridge. The centaurs seize her, and she is swiftly carried off into the depths of the forest. They run back through the dense forest towards the safety of Hogwarts, where Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron eagerly run to meet them. Harry stands facing his friends, and together with Hermione, Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, they soar above the expansive pine forest astride the leathery back of a thestral. Harry holds on tightly, looking around at his companions, and flying close behind, Luna gives him a bright, happy smile. The thestrals fly through the stormy night, buffeted by strong, gusty winds, and at long last, the familiar lights of Canary Wharf and the winding River Thames appear below them. They run through the deserted corridors of the Ministry of Magic towards a long, ominous corridor lined with shiny black tiles. Harry moves forward cautiously, and the others follow him along the dark corridor towards the blue door at the far end. Inside, they find a shadowy storeroom filled with high, wooden shelves, and they hold up their lighted wands to illuminate the space. Standing on the numbered shelves are thousands of cloudy glass spheres, and the door behind them slides away silently. The rows of glass spheres fill the shelves, which stand close together and extend upwards high above their heads. By the light of his wand, Harry searches the long, dark passages between the shelves and stops to shine his wand down onto the empty floor. He turns to his friends, as Neville is intently reading a label on a shelf beneath one of the spheres. As Harry walks towards it, the sphere begins to glow, illuminating the swirling mist inside it, and Harry reaches out and carefully lifts it down. Harry steps in front of his friends, and they instinctively move closer together as a masked Death Eater approaches slowly along the passage. Lucius Malfoy unmasks, revealing his identity, and Harry holds Neville back as dark figures approach down the passageways. The masked figures draw ever closer, and the friends make a run for it, but Lucius suddenly appears in front of them, forcing them to turn back. Luna is knocked down, but she quickly raises her wand, and her attacker vanishes. Neville stuns a Death Eater, and Luna pulls him away as more Death Eaters appear to block the passages. Pursued relentlessly, Hermione flicks her wand, and glass spheres smash down onto their pursuers, creating chaos.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: As he turns to leave, Snape, with a subtle yet noticeable shift in his posture, pivots back around and raises his eyebrows in a questioning and inquisitive manner. With unwavering and resolute determination, Umbridge confidently raises her wand in the mysterious and foreboding depths of the Forbidden Forest. Harry quickly catches up with Hermione just as the frayed and worn-out end of Gwarp's rope lies discarded on the forest floor, seemingly forgotten. Umbridge appears dirty and disheveled when shadowy and ominous creatures begin to emerge from among the trees, casting eerie shadows. Nervously, Umbridge takes a cautious step back and wags a finger in a futile attempt to assert some semblance of control. The creatures, armed with bows and arrows, pose a real threat, and she manages to deflect an arrow that is aimed directly at her. She points her wand with intent, and a centaur falls to the ground, a strangling rope tightening around its throat as it writhes and thrashes in visible distress. Hermione desperately tries to release the centaur, but in a sudden and unexpected turn of events, Umbridge is lifted into the air by Gwarp. The centaurs charge forward, firing arrows with precision, and as Gwarp is pierced by multiple arrows, he drops Umbridge. The centaurs seize her, and she is swiftly carried off into the depths of the forest. They run back hurriedly through the dense and tangled forest towards the safety of Hogwarts, where Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron eagerly rush forward to meet them. Harry stands facing his friends, and together with Hermione, Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, they soar above the expansive pine forest astride the leathery back of a thestral. Harry holds on tightly, looking around at his companions, and flying close behind, Luna gives him a bright, happy smile. The thestrals fly through the stormy night, buffeted by strong, gusty winds, and at long last, the familiar, welcoming lights of Canary Wharf and the winding River Thames appear below them. They run through the deserted corridors of the Ministry of Magic towards a long, ominous corridor lined with shiny black tiles. Harry moves forward cautiously, and the others follow him along the dark and foreboding corridor towards the blue door at the far end. Inside, they find a shadowy storeroom filled with high, wooden shelves, and they hold up their lighted wands to illuminate the dim space. Standing on the densely packed, numbered shelves are thousands of cloudy glass spheres, and the door behind them slides away silently, almost as if by magic. The rows of glass spheres fill the shelves, which stand close together and extend upwards high above their heads. By the light of his wand, Harry searches the long, dark passages between the shelves and stops to shine his wand down onto the empty floor. He turns to his friends, as Neville is intently reading a label on a shelf beneath one of the spheres. As Harry walks towards it, the sphere begins to glow, illuminating the swirling mist inside it, and Harry reaches out and carefully lifts it down. Harry steps in front of his friends, and they instinctively move closer together as a masked Death Eater approaches slowly along the passage. Lucius Malfoy unmasks, revealing his identity, and Harry holds Neville back as dark, menacing figures approach down the passageways. The masked figures draw ever closer, and the friends make a run for it, but Lucius suddenly appears in front of them, forcing them to turn back. Luna is knocked down, but she quickly and skillfully raises her wand, and her attacker vanishes. Neville stuns a Death Eater, and Luna pulls him away as more Death Eaters appear to block the passages. Pursued relentlessly, Hermione flicks her wand, and glass spheres smash down onto their pursuers, creating chaos and disarray.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As he decides to leave, he turns away, prompting Snape to turn back and raise his eyebrows in a gesture of curiosity or surprise. Meanwhile, with a look of determination, Umbridge raises her wand high in the air while standing in the ominous setting of the Forbidden Forest. Harry, moving quickly, catches up with Hermione just as the frayed end of Gwarp's rope lies discarded on the forest floor. Umbridge, now appearing dirty and disheveled, finds herself in a tense situation as shadowy creatures begin to emerge from the dense trees surrounding her. Feeling a surge of nervousness, she takes a step back and wags a finger in a futile attempt to assert control. The creatures, armed with bows and arrows, prepare to attack, and she manages to deflect an incoming arrow with a swift motion of her wand. She then points her wand with intent, causing a centaur to fall to the ground, a strangling rope tightening around its throat as it writhes and thrashes in distress. Hermione, driven by a desire to help, attempts to release the centaur, but before she can succeed, Gwarp intervenes by lifting Umbridge into the air. In response, the centaurs charge forward, unleashing a volley of arrows, and as Gwarp is pierced by the arrows, he releases his grip, causing Umbridge to fall. The centaurs seize the opportunity to grab her, and she is swiftly carried off into the depths of the forest. In the aftermath, they make a hasty retreat through the forest, heading back towards the safety of Hogwarts, where they are met by Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, who run to join them. Harry turns to face his friends, and together with Hermione, Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, they mount the leathery back of a thestral, soaring above the pine forest. As they fly, Harry clings tightly to the thestral, taking a moment to glance around at his companions, and he catches a glimpse of Luna flying close behind, who offers him a happy smile. The thestrals navigate through the stormy night, buffeted by strong winds, until the familiar lights of Canary Wharf and the winding River Thames come into view below them. They make their way through the deserted Ministry of Magic, moving quickly towards a long corridor lined with shiny black tiles. Harry leads the way, advancing cautiously, with the others following closely behind as they proceed along the black corridor towards the blue door at the far end. Upon entering, they find themselves in a shadowy storeroom filled with high, wooden shelves, and they raise their lighted wands to illuminate the space. The shelves, numbered and towering above them, hold thousands of cloudy glass spheres, and as the door behind them slides shut, they are surrounded by rows of these mysterious objects. By the light of his wand, Harry searches the long, dark passages between the shelves, pausing to shine his wand down onto the empty floor. He turns to his friends, noticing Neville reading a label on a shelf beneath one of the spheres. As Harry approaches, the sphere begins to glow, casting light on the swirling mist inside it, and he reaches out to lift it down. Stepping in front of his friends, they instinctively move closer together as a masked Death Eater slowly approaches along the passage. Lucius Malfoy reveals his identity by unmasking, and Harry instinctively holds Neville back as more dark figures begin to close in from the passageways. As the masked figures draw nearer, the friends decide to make a run for it, but Lucius suddenly appears in front of them, forcing them to turn back. In the ensuing chaos, Luna is knocked down, but she quickly raises her wand, causing her attacker to vanish. Neville manages to stun a Death Eater, and Luna helps him to his feet, pulling him away as more Death Eaters appear to block their escape routes. Pursued relentlessly, Hermione flicks her wand with precision, causing glass spheres to come crashing down onto their pursuers, creating a momentary distraction.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Snape raises his eyebrows as he turns away, while Umbridge, determined, raises her wand in the Forbidden Forest. Harry catches up with Hermione near Gwarp's rope, and they find Umbridge disheveled as shadowy creatures emerge. Nervously, Umbridge deflects an arrow and ensnares a centaur with a strangling rope. Hermione attempts to help, but Gwarp lifts Umbridge, who is then dropped and carried off by charging centaurs. Harry and Hermione, joined by Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, race back to Hogwarts. They mount thestrals and soar above the forest, with Luna smiling at Harry. The thestrals navigate stormy winds, revealing the lights of Canary Wharf and the River Thames below. They rush through the deserted Ministry of Magic to a corridor lined with shiny black tiles, cautiously advancing toward a blue door. Inside, they illuminate a shadowy storeroom filled with high shelves of cloudy glass spheres. Harry searches the passages, stopping as Neville reads a label beneath a glowing sphere. Harry lifts it down, and as they gather, a masked Death Eater approaches. Lucius Malfoy unmasks, prompting Harry to hold Neville back as dark figures close in. The friends attempt to flee but are blocked by Lucius. Luna, knocked down, vanishes her attacker, while Neville stuns another. Luna pulls Neville away as Hermione smashes glass spheres onto their pursuers.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He turns to go, and Snape, the Potions Master known for his deep knowledge and complex allegiances, turns back and raises his eyebrows. With determination, Umbridge, who recently became Hogwarts’ controversial Defense Against the Dark Arts professor, raises her wand in the Forbidden Forest, a dense and ancient woodland home to many magical creatures. Harry catches up with Hermione as the frayed end of Gwarp's rope lies on the ground, a giant roughly the height of a small building. Umbridge is dirty and disheveled when shadowy creatures, centaurs known for their wisdom and archery skills, appear amongst the trees. Umbridge steps back nervously and wags a finger. They have bows and arrows, typically crafted from the strong wood of the forest, and she deflects an arrow. She points her wand, and a centaur falls, a strangling rope, a magical construct intended for restraint, around its throat, as it writhes and thrashes. Hermione tries to release it, but Umbridge is lifted into the air by Gwarp, the giant with a gentle demeanor despite his size. The centaurs charge, firing arrows, and pierced by arrows, Gwarp drops Umbridge. The centaurs grab her, and she is carried off, likely to face their own brand of justice. They run back through the forest towards Hogwarts, the renowned school of witchcraft and wizardry, where Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron run to meet them. Harry faces his friends, and they, along with Hermione, Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron, soar above the pine forest astride the leathery back of a thestral, a winged horse that can only be seen by those who have witnessed death. Harry holds on tightly and looks around at his companions, and flying close behind, Luna gives him a happy smile, her perceptive nature noticing the tension easing. The thestrals fly through the stormy night buffeted by strong winds, and at last, the familiar lights of Canary Wharf, a major business district in London, and the winding River Thames appear below them. They run through the deserted Ministry of Magic, the government building for wizards, towards a long corridor lined with shiny black tiles. Harry moves forward cautiously, and the others follow him along the black corridor towards the blue door at the far end. Inside is a shadowy storeroom full of high, wooden shelves, and they hold up their lighted wands. Standing on the numbered shelves are thousands of cloudy glass spheres, known as Prophecy Orbs, as the door behind them slides away. The rows of glass spheres fill the shelves, which stand close together and extend upwards high above their heads. By the light of his wand, Harry searches the long, dark passages between the shelves and stops to shine his wand down onto the empty floor. He turns to his friends, as Neville is reading a label, usually inscribed with the name of the prophecy's subject, on a shelf beneath one of the spheres. As Harry walks towards it, the sphere starts to glow, illuminating the swirling mist, a magical record of foresight, inside it, and Harry reaches out and lifts it down. Harry steps in front of his friends, and they move closer together as a masked Death Eater, followers of Lord Voldemort with a penchant for dark magic, approaches slowly along the passage. Lucius Malfoy, a member of a wealthy and influential pure-blood family known for their support of Voldemort, unmasks, and Harry holds Neville back as dark figures approach down the passageways. The masked figures draw closer, and the friends run for it, but Lucius appears in front of them, so they turn back. Luna is knocked down, but she raises her wand, and her attacker vanishes, probably disoriented by her spell. Neville stuns a Death Eater with a well-aimed spell, and Luna pulls him away as more Death Eaters appear to block the passages. Pursued, Hermione flicks her wand, and glass spheres smash down onto their pursuers, creating chaos and confusion in the narrow aisles.

In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. The thestrals fly through the stormy night buffeted by strong winds and at last the familiar lights of Canary Wharf and the winding River Thames appear below them. They run through the deserted Ministry of Magic towards a long corridor lined with shiny black tiles. Harry moves forward cautiously and the others follow him along the black corridor towards the blue door at the far end. Standing on the numbered shelves are thousands of cloudy glass spheres as the door behind them slides away. The rows of glass spheres fill the shelves which stand close together and extend upwards high above their heads. By the light of his wand Harry searches the long dark passages between the shelves and stops to shine his wand down onto the empty floor. Neville stuns a Death Eater and Luna pulls him away as more Death Eaters appear to block the passages. Pursued Hermione flicks her wand and glass spheres smash down onto their pursuers.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He turns to go and Snape turns back and raises his eyebrows. With determination Umbridge raises her wand in the Forbidden Forest. Harry catches up with Hermione as the frayed end of Gwarp's rope lies on the ground. Umbridge is dirty and disheveled when shadowy creatures appear amongst the trees. Umbridge steps back nervously and wags a finger. They have bows and arrows and she deflects an arrow. She points her wand and a centaur falls a strangling rope around its throat as it writhes and thrashes. Hermione tries to release it but Umbridge is lifted into the air by Gwarp. The centaurs charge firing arrows and pierced by arrows. Gwarp drops Umbridge. The centaurs grab her and she is carried off. They run back through the forest towards Hogwarts where Neville Luna Ginny and Ron run to meet them. Harry faces his friends and they along with Hermione Neville Luna Ginny and Ron soar above the pine forest astride the leathery back of a thestral. Harry holds on tightly and looks around at his companions and flying close behind Luna gives him a happy smile. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. The thestrals fly through the stormy night buffeted by strong winds and at last the familiar lights of Canary Wharf and the winding River Thames appear below them. They run through the deserted Ministry of Magic towards a long corridor lined with shiny black tiles. Harry moves forward cautiously and the others follow him along the black corridor towards the blue door at the far end. Inside is a shadowy storeroom full of high wooden shelves and they hold up their lighted wands. Standing on the numbered shelves are thousands of cloudy glass spheres as the door behind them slides away. The rows of glass spheres fill the shelves which stand close together and extend upwards high above their heads. By the light of his wand Harry searches the long dark passages between the shelves and stops to shine his wand down onto the empty floor. He turns to his friends as Neville is reading a label on a shelf beneath one of the spheres. As Harry walks towards it the sphere starts to glow illuminating the swirling mist inside it and Harry reaches out and lifts it down. Harry steps in front of his friends and they move closer together as a masked Death Eater approaches slowly along the passage. Lucius Malfoy unmasks and Harry holds Neville back as dark figures approach down the passageways. The masked figures draw closer and the friends run for it but Lucius appears in front of them so they turn back. Luna is knocked down but she raises her wand and her attacker vanishes. Neville stuns a Death Eater and Luna pulls him away as more Death Eaters appear to block the passages. Pursued Hermione flicks her wand and glass spheres smash down onto their pursuers.

Umbridge steps back nervously and wags a finger. They have bows and arrows and she deflects an arrow. test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: He turns to go and Snape turns back and raises his eyebrows. With determination Umbridge raises her wand in the Forbidden Forest. Harry catches up with Hermione as the frayed end of Gwarp's rope lies on the ground. Luna is knocked down but she raises her wand and her attacker vanishes. Neville stuns a Death Eater and Luna pulls him away as more Death Eaters appear to block the passages. Pursued Hermione flicks her wand and glass spheres smash down onto their pursuers.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat pivots to leave, and the chef pivots back and lowers his monocle. With whimsy, the detective lowers her umbrella in the Forbidden City. John catches up with Alice as the tattered edge of the bear's scarf lays on the pavement. The detective is muddy and rumpled when luminous phantoms emerge amongst the skyscrapers. The detective steps forward boldly and swings a lantern. They have spears and swords, and she blocks a spear. She waves her umbrella, and a goblin tumbles, a sizzling chain around its ankle, as it flails and kicks. Alice tries to unshackle it, but the detective is hoisted into the sky by the bear. The goblins advance, throwing spears, and skewered by spears, the bear releases the detective. The goblins seize her, and she is spirited away. They sprint back through the jungle towards the theme park, where Sam, Chloe, Lily, and Paul dash to join them. John greets his allies, and they, along with Alice, Sam, Chloe, Lily, and Paul, sail above the bamboo canopy astride the velvety wings of a dragonfly. John grips tightly and glances at his comrades, and hovering close by, Chloe sends him a cheerful grin. The dragonflies sail through the sunny morning caressed by gentle breezes, and at last, the distant lights of the Eiffel Tower and the meandering River Seine come into view below them. They dash through the abandoned Palace of Wisdom towards a narrow hallway lined with glossy white tiles. John advances confidently, and the others trail him along the white hallway towards the red gate at the far end. Inside is a glowing cellar stacked with low, iron trunks, and they raise their blazing flashlights. Resting on the numbered trunks are dozens of clear crystal eggs as the gate behind them drifts away. The lines of crystal eggs cover the trunks, which rest close together and rise upwards far above their heads. By the glow of his flashlight, John explores the short, bright aisles between the trunks and pauses to shine his flashlight down onto the polished carpet. He turns to his allies, as Sam is inspecting a tag on a trunk beneath one of the eggs. As John drifts towards it, the egg begins to shimmer, illuminating the spinning fog inside it, and John reaches over and plucks it down. John stands in front of his allies, and they huddle closer as a cloaked ghost hovers slowly along the aisle. Arthur Weasley unveils, and John restrains Sam as pale shapes glide down the aisles. The cloaked shapes drift closer, and the allies dart for it, but Arthur materializes before them, so they retreat. Chloe is bowled over, but she lifts her flashlight, and her assailant dissolves. Sam freezes a ghost, and Chloe tugs him away as additional ghosts glide to seal the aisles. Pursued, Alice swishes her flashlight, and crystal eggs shatter onto their pursuers.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Snape departs, and Umbridge, determined, raises her wand in the Forbidden Forest. Harry and Hermione find Gwarp's rope on the ground. Disheveled, Umbridge encounters shadowy creatures with bows. She deflects an arrow, but a centaur is caught by a strangling rope. Hermione tries to help, but Umbridge is lifted by Gwarp. The centaurs charge, fire arrows, and Gwarp drops Umbridge. She's captured and taken away. Harry, Hermione, Neville, Luna, Ginny, and Ron fly on thestrals over the stormy night, spotting Canary Wharf and the River Thames below. They reach the Ministry of Magic, moving through a corridor to a storeroom lined with shelves of glass spheres. Harry, illuminated by wandlight, finds a glowing sphere and lifts it. As a masked Death Eater, Lucius Malfoy, approaches, Harry and his friends are pursued. Luna counters her attacker, and Neville stuns a Death Eater. More Death Eaters block their way, but Hermione's spell sends glass spheres crashing down on them.
